com.atakmap.android.maps

Class Ellipse

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.android.maps.FilterMetaDataHolder
      • com.atakmap.android.maps.MapItem
        • com.atakmap.android.maps.Shape
          • com.atakmap.android.maps.Polyline
            • com.atakmap.android.maps.Ellipse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    URIContent, HashtagContent, Capturable, MetaDataHolder, VisibilityListener

    public class Ellipse
extends Polyline
    An ellipse with a width, length, and angle Angle - The "heading" of the ellipse in true north Length - The diameter of the ellipse that runs parallel to the angle Width - The diameter of the ellipse that runs perpendicular to the angle

        Set the radius of the major axis The major axis is the longer diameter in the ellipse It's recommended to use setWidth(double) or setLength(double) instead

      • setDimensions

        public void setDimensions(double minorRadius,
                          double majorRadius)
        Sets the dimensions of the ellipse using the minor and major values in meters
        Parameters:
        minorRadius - the minor radius in meters
        majorRadius - the major radius in meters

      • setDimensions

        public void setDimensions(GeoPointMetaData center,
                          double minorRadius,
                          double majorRadius)
        Sets the dimensions and location of the ellipse using the minor and major values in meters
        Parameters:
        center - the center of the elipse
        minorRadius - the minor radius in meters
        majorRadius - the major radius in meters

      • setDimensions

        public void setDimensions(GeoPointMetaData center,
                          double minorRadius,
                          double majorRadius,
                          double angle)
        Sets the dimensions and location of the ellipse using the minor and major values in meters Based on the CoT Shape Schema, the angle represents the orientation of the major axis. Therefore the major radius in this context always corresponds to the length of the ellipse.
        Parameters:
        center - the center of the ellipse
        minorRadius - the minor radius in meters
        majorRadius - the major radius in meters
        angle - the angle of the ellipse in degrees clock wise.

      • getSweepStart

        public int getSweepStart()
        Returns the sweep start. In the case of a full ellipse start will equal end or start = 0 and end = 360.

      • getSweepEnd

        public int getSweepEnd()
        Returns the sweep end. In the case of a full ellipse start will equal end or start = 0 and end = 360.

      • setSweep

        public void setSweep(int start,
                     int end)
        Sets a sweep for a ellipse.
        Parameters:
        start - must be a number ranging from [0, 360].
        end - must be a number ranging from [0, 360].

      • setFillStyle

        public void setFillStyle(int newFill)
        Sets the fill style
        Parameters:
        newFill - the fill style one 1 for filled or 0 for unfilled.

      • getFillStyle

        public int getFillStyle()
        Returns the fill style for this ellipse.
        Returns:
        fill style which can be either 1 for filled or 0 for unfilled.

      • setHeightWidth

        @Deprecated
public void setHeightWidth(double newH,
                                       double newW)
        Deprecated. Use setDimensions(double, double)
        Sets the height and width of the ellipse. Calling this will reduce the number of full calculations performed when setting height and width separately.
        Parameters:
        newW - the width in meters.
        newH - the height in meters.

      • setCenterHeightWidth

        @Deprecated
public void setCenterHeightWidth(GeoPointMetaData newCenter,
                                             double newH,
                                             double newW)
        Deprecated. Use setDimensions(GeoPointMetaData, double, double)
        Sets the height, width and center point of the ellipse. Calling this will reduce the number of full calculations performed when setting height and width and center separately.
        Parameters:
        newCenter - the center of the ellipse.
        newW - the width in meters.
        newH - the height in meters.

      • setCenterHeightWidthAngle

        @Deprecated
public void setCenterHeightWidthAngle(GeoPointMetaData newCenter,
                                                  double newH,
                                                  double newW,
                                                  double newAngle)
        Deprecated. Use setDimensions(GeoPointMetaData, double, double, double)
        Sets the height, width and center point of the ellipse. Calling this will reduce the number of full calculations performed when setting height, width, center and angle separately.
        Parameters:
        newCenter - the center of the ellipse.
        newW - the width in meters.
        newH - the height in meters.
        newAngle - the angle in degrees
